problems.title: Maximum Product of Two Elements
problems.description:
Problem Statement

You are given an array of N positive integers.
Find the maximum value of (nums[i] - 1) * (nums[j] - 1) where i != j.

Use the greedy observation: To maximize the product, pick the two largest elements!
problems.examples:
Sample Input
4
3 4 5 2

Sample Output
12

Explanation:
Array: [3, 4, 5, 2]
Two largest elements are 5 and 4.
Maximum product = (5-1) * (4-1) = 4 * 3 = 12
